text: Is there any problem when we use third party software with HubSpot? Because GDPR restricts transfers of personal data outside the EEA & we need to use middleware. Any suggestions?
Does anyone have any recommendations for GeoIP redirection software to use with HubSpot?
<https://github.com/nekudocom/shiny_geoip>
Here as a service <https://ipapi.com/>
here is simple js for using that api (uses the old deprecated api, but is easy to update to use the newer one or own) <https://gist.github.com/panoply/ef3396e3f216d8a231d9a6440e324d1b>

well yeah lazy loading for content below the fold like <@UFH0PPMEW> said but i have tried using <https://www.kelp.agency/blog/HubSpot-how-to-lazy-load-images-in-rich-text-modules> but it didn't work and i still see images loading as normal. I have 200+ images on the page and that increases the page load time a lot

Okay thanks for sharing this <@UH8TS9BC5>
I think we've now made a decision to use a soft IP redirection approach instead...
I'm thinking of utilising the smart content in HubSpot as a popup, however, not sure if we can set this to only appear once per session...
Is there a recommended practice for HubSpot mobile menus with sub levels drop downs, when I click on a link goes to next page before teh drop down comes down
I think you need to turn on flyouts in the menu
Thanks Jon but they are enabled, the problem is on mobile when the top level is touched the menu clicks through to that page before a user can see the drop down items
Do you have a link that we can look at? Could help us identify a solution for you.
<https://www.moonoia.com/>
cheers

Not sure if anyone else is getting 404s on their HS CDN content…but if you are (like we were), re-uploading the files might fix the issue. It worked for us.
I haven’t seen anyone here complaining about that yet, but figured I’d post in case it comes up for someone else.
we've been having lots of issues with this too. It just doesn't show anymore so I have to go stright to the login page
on chrome?
on chrome
only started happening in the past few days so I'm assuming it's related, so hopefully it fixes itself
"fixes itself"
that is what i say when i get a QA task
i say it when i have no idea what the issue is and I hope it isn't urgent
i blame the weather.
it is on and off randomly. I just direct straight to <http://login.HubSpot.com|login.HubSpot.com> for now until all issues are square

I can see the issue with it using hover to show the sub-menu items, I would recommend rebuilding your nav into  custom module and making use of the new `menu()` function so you can custom code one out, then when an item has children, you can include addtional markup (like a dropdown arrow) to be a clickable element.

otherwise, to continue with what you are doing now, I would recommend having the nested UL's displayed for mobile and then simply allow overflow of scrolling on the nav and use something to stylize the scrollbar
thats just first thoughts from seeing it, there are probably other options out there too

Think I’ve seen this in the past, just hoping someone can verify.

*Does HubSpot effectively change `@import url` css functions into the equivalent of a hubl include. (injecting the imported css file)?*
(in other words it doesn’t do a real css @import, it uses server-side logic to pull that code into the file itself.)
I ask as I’m trying to re-think the best way to add Web Fonts to our projects.
I've never seen that before. I've always moved any `@imports` in a stylesheet as a regular style tag to the head for better time to first paint
two stylesheets in the head can both load at the same time. 1 stylesheet with imports inside of it require sequential loading

right. I’m aware, I’m saying I think I’ve seen HS treat an @import like you would treat it if you were using a build process, where it becomes one file.

That way you’re not making a 2 calls like that.

I usually just `require_css` the font. Guess I’ll probably keep going that route. Probably better in the age of HTTP2
Thank AJ I think its the only way!

HS keeps the @import.
Although if its a internal file you can do it manually with:
`{% import %}`
well, you’d wanna use an include. import just carries HubL vars
right
but thank you for the info on it keeping the @import
that’s what I needed to know :slightly_smiling_face:
Yo anyone have the package link for HubSpot salesofrce install handy?

anyone know if there is a setting in the CMS for trailing slashes by default?

Do people develop for 4k? I got an email from a client who is asking if the page is responsive for bigger screens and they sent a screenshot of the page on a 4k resolution. My understanding was that the lack of 4k usage meant that developing for 4k wasn't a big deal but if I'm just lazy then that's good to know too
on my 4k screen 99% of the time there is just a lot of whitespace that gets added
full-with images are expanding to 4k with and almost every page just has a fixed width of max 1600px
so, if your Page looks fine in 1920 px there is probably just whitespace added around it in 4k
I think they're main concern was a absolutely positioned element in the bottom right of the screen and how weird it looked due to all the added whitespace

I do what Andreas said. basically just add whitespace.

Unless I’m building a big ol app interface, the extra screen realestate usually doesn’t justify adding clutter
Also how many people with 4K monitors actually browse websites full screen?
me :smile:
sometimes ;)…

lol I have one at home, and I can tell you the only reason I fullscreen a site like that is to watch a video at a bigger resolution without fullscreening it, or to get that minimalist feel like the Zen mode many rich text editors have
99% it is the same with me
yeah i just enjoy that the higher resolution gives me more screen real estate to work with
yea, I don’t really like that scaling effect. personally
keeps everything in the same proportion

personal preference - not saying it’s a bad practice or anything like that at all.

I’m just like “you wouldn’t simply scale up a business card to use it as a billboard would you?”
if it's a good business card, sure lol
the VW trick though I do like in general, I just put an upper limit is all
I like it mainly for the look on 5k iMacs. I'm sure on 16x9 4k monitors it probably isn't as nice, but it makes the experience from MPB to iMac very similar
Even on Code Gallery... hahahah dying hahahahah
Well now we know lol if a user updates their profile pic on Github does it auto update on the  Code Gallery? :white_check_mark:
the best part is at a distance/small that hair looks convincing.
